title: Add a UI button that does nothing

requirements.text: Create a single-page UI that displays one clearly-labeled button; clicking/tapping the button must intentionally perform no action (no navigation, no state change, no network calls, no console logging, no alerts/toasts).

quotes: make a button that does nothing

acceptanceCriteria: The page renders a visible button with English label text.
Clicking the button does not change any visible UI state and does not trigger any side effects (no route changes, no backend calls, no console output, no dialogs).
The button remains enabled and clickable.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent visual theme across the page (colors, typography, spacing, and button styling) with a distinct style direction that fits a playful 'minimal UI' concept; keep styling consistent across all components used.

quotes: make a button that does nothing

acceptanceCriteria: The UI uses a consistent color palette and typography choices (not the default unstyled look).
The button styling matches the overall theme and has clear hover/focus states.
All user-facing text is in English.

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing UI components instead).
Do not add any backend canisters or external services; keep the app within the single-actor backend architecture if backend code exists (no backend changes required for this request).
nonGoals: Adding button functionality (saving data, navigation, API calls, toasts, alerts, analytics, logging).
User authentication or any Internet Identity flows.
